intro: Pabstia triptera, commonly known as the three-lobed pabstia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive tri-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
